answers.answer: Glad they help you and thanks for sharing I am sure it will help many people here !!!

THANK YO Ufor this.  Mine burn also in tennis. I went and bought some fake crocs at Walm the other day and those help too, but not very comfortable, since they are the real thing.  But at least for one day, my feet did not burn at work. Thanks for this,k I will check into it. I am not "officialy diagnosed" yet, but I have fasting test on Monday.  (I pretty much know I have it based on my BS readings off hubby's monitor). I have neuropathy in my feet, just diagnosed.

question: I do not have diabetes, but I do have peripheral neuropathy and my feet burn like crazy.  I thought this would be a good forum to let you guys know the shoes I found.  Tennis shoes make my feet burn, even running shoes with the mesh.  I finally went online and bought some Merrell Primo Breeze IIs.  I just want to say they are worth the $70, every penny.  They keep my feet cool and are soooo comfy.  Anyway, just thought I should share - They make a difference in my day:)
title: Awesome Shoes!!!
